SEARCH
Package fr.lirmm.chocominer.api.services.managers

Interface MiningManagerInterface<T extends PatternInterface>

Type Parameters:
T - The type of pattern (Itemset or Association Rule) that the run(ConstraintsRequest, String) method returns.
All Known Implementing Classes:
ARMDeclarativeManager, ARMSpecializedManager, IMDeclarativeManager, IMDeclarativeToSpecializedManager, IMSpecializedManager, IMSpecializedToDeclarativeManager
public interface MiningManagerInterface<T extends PatternInterface>
Interface for all Mining Managers, there are different types of mining such as declarative, specialized. These use different libraries and have different structures it is consequently necessary to have classes to manages these different structures.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Solutions<T>>
    run(ConstraintsRequest constraintsRequest, String filePath)
    Executes a mining process based on the types of mining, the given constraints and file path.

  • Method Details

    • run

      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Solutions<T>> run(ConstraintsRequest constraintsRequest, String filePath) throws IOException, InstantiationException, UndefinedConstraintParameterException, InvocationTargetException, NotEnoughParametersException, IllegalAccessException, InvalidDeclarativeConstraintsException, ConstraintsNotConvertableException
      Executes a mining process based on the types of mining, the given constraints and file path.
      Parameters:
      constraintsRequest - The request containing a list of constraints to be used for the mining process.
      filePath - The path to the file containing the transactions used in the mining process.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the solutions or outcomes of the mining process.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the file or resource.
      InstantiationException - If an error occurs during instantiation of mining components.
      UndefinedConstraintParameterException - If a needed parameter for the instantiation of a concrete constraint is undefined or missing.
      InvocationTargetException - If an error occurs while invoking methods during mining.
      NotEnoughParametersException - If there are not enough arguments provided for the instantiation of a concrete constraint.
      IllegalAccessException - If an error occurs due to illegal access during mining.
      InvalidDeclarativeConstraintsException - If the provided declarative constraints are invalid. For more information on what an invalid combination of constraints is, refer to: DeclarativeVerifier
      ConstraintsNotConvertableException
